Flowgraph¶

Description¶

Flowgraphs describe what new information can be created with a given graphstate and given programs. Each graphstate in the flowgraph is a connected information graph.

How flowgraphs build themselves¶

The standard method for creation is flowgraph.from_programs. Creation takes the inputstates of the programs as startpoints. Each graphstate will be tried as input for each program. If the graphstate contains a valid inputstate, new graphstates will be developed via the method spawn_prev_state_from_program with the possible new axiom of the program.

Every state tries to create parents and offspring with each program and the generated states will be added to the flowgraph. Parents will be created via its method spawn_prev_state_from_program. Offspring will be created via its method spawn_next_state_from_program For each generated offspring a new edge will be added to the flowgraph between inputstate and possible new states after the usage of a program. On Each edge will be saved, which program was used and what the new axioms are to generate the new graphstate.

If a state has a parentstate from a via a certain program, the method spawn_prev_state_from_program wont be used to create new state with this program. This limits the number of states that are generated in the creation process.

extra thingis¶

class _flowgraph.Edge_program¶
_flowgraph.FLOWGRAPH_EDGEMAP = (<class '_flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class '_flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class '_flowgraph.Edge_program'>, typing.Dict)¶

Direction from first to second graph. Includes the program used and a mapping of inputterms from first (input)graphstate to inputgraph of used program

class _flowgraph.GraphState¶

A Graph as a state.

abstract spawn_next_state_from_program(program: Edge_program)¶
Return type:

Iterable[ GraphState ]

abstract spawn_prev_state_from_program(program: Edge_program)¶
Return type:

Iterable[ GraphState ]

abstract spawn_starting_states_from_program(program: Edge_program)¶

Use this method as input for flowgraph.from_programs for parameter function_find_starstates. This method should create a set of possible starting states, from which the rest of the graph can be ascertained by usage of programs. (Just use inputgraph)

Return type:

Iterable[ GraphState ]

class _flowgraph.Program¶
class _flowgraph.flowgraph(states: ~_flowgraph.GraphState, flowedges: (<class '_flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class '_flowgraph.GraphState'>, <class '_flowgraph.Edge_program'>, typing.Dict))¶

Directed Graph with rdfgraphs as nodes and programs as edges. Shows with which program you can get from one state to another.

create_directionmap_for_output(possible_endgraphs)¶

Find mapping of states to next state to reach one state of possible_endgraphs fastest.

Return type:

Dict[ datastate, Edge_program ]

classmethod from_programs(programs: Iterable[Program], function_find_startstates: Callable[[Program], Iterable[GraphState]], limit_flowgraph_size=True)¶

Produces reachable states from programs. If a state can be generated via a program from another state, this program cant wont be used to create new states from this state on.

Parameters:

limit_flowgraph_size – If this parameter is set, the maximal number of contained states is limited to 5**number of programs

Todo:

use abbrevations for edgetypes for debugging logging

Todo:

change use of translation to use of new axioms, when creating new offspring graphstates

get_possible_processes(inputstate: GraphState, outputstates: Optional[GraphState] = None, neighbouring_graphstates=True)¶

Find out which program can be used on inputstate. Can be filtered by programs, that can produce outputstate.

Parameters:

  • neighbouring_graphstates (bool) – If unset to False also searches programs, which may lead to graphstate if this method is called repeatedly. Or searches for indirect connections to outputstates and returns the first programs, that can be used

  • target_superstates (bool) – If set will search for superstates of given outputstates instead of the outputstates themselve

Return type:

Iterable[ Dict, program ]

Returns:

list of translation of input and the program useable on inputstate and producing outputstate
